SR._description: Storage Ring: Main synchrotron light source operating at 1.9 GeV. Contains beam position monitors, corrector magnets, RF cavities, and beam diagnostics. 12-sector ring with 196.8m circumference.

BPM._description: Beam Position Monitors: Non-invasive electrostatic pickups that measure beam position in horizontal (X) and vertical (Y) planes. Critical for orbit correction and beam stability. 96 BPMs distributed around ring (8 per sector).

X._description: Horizontal position readback in millimeters. Measured using button electrode signals.

Y._description: Vertical position readback in millimeters. Measured using button electrode signals.

SumSignal._description: Total button signal intensity. Proportional to beam current.

XError._description: Horizontal position error/uncertainty in micrometers. Statistical error from signal processing.

YError._description: Vertical position error/uncertainty in micrometers. Statistical error from signal processing.

HCM._description: Horizontal Corrector Magnets: Small dipole steering magnets for fine horizontal beam position adjustments. Used in closed-orbit correction algorithms. 72 correctors total (6 per sector).

Monitor._description: Current readback in Amperes. Actual measured corrector current from DCCT.

Setpoint._description: Current setpoint in Amperes. Commanded corrector current for orbit control.

OnControl._description: Enable/disable control for corrector magnet power supply.

Ready._description: Power supply ready status. 1=ready to accept commands, 0=fault or not ready.

VCM._description: Vertical Corrector Magnets: Small dipole steering magnets for fine vertical (Y) beam position adjustments. Work with BPMs in feedback loops to maintain desired orbit. 72 correctors total (6 per sector).

Monitor._description: Current readback in Amperes. Bipolar current for vertical steering.

Setpoint._description: Current setpoint in Amperes. Commanded vertical corrector current.

Ready._description: Power supply ready status. 1=ready to accept commands, 0=fault or not ready.

QF._description: Focusing Quadrupoles: Quadrupole magnets with positive gradient. Focus beam in horizontal plane, defocus in vertical plane. Part of tune correction system. 24 quadrupoles total (2 per sector).

Monitor._description: Quadrupole Excitation Current readback (Amperes). Current through QF coil windings. Proportional to positive field gradient.

Setpoint._description: Quadrupole Excitation Current setpoint (Amperes). Commanded focusing current for tune correction.

Ready._description: Power supply ready status for quadrupole magnets.

QD._description: Defocusing Quadrupoles: Quadrupole magnets with negative gradient. Defocus beam in horizontal plane, focus in vertical plane. Work together with QF magnets for independent horizontal/vertical tune control. 24 quadrupoles total (2 per sector).

Monitor._description: Quadrupole Excitation Current readback (Amperes). Proportional to negative field gradient.

Setpoint._description: Quadrupole Excitation Current setpoint (Amperes). Commanded defocusing current for tune correction.

Ready._description: Power supply ready status for quadrupole magnets.

SF._description: Focusing Sextupoles: Sextupole magnets with positive polarity for chromatic correction. Produce field that varies quadratically with radius. Compensate for energy-dependent focusing from quadrupoles. 24 sextupoles total (2 per sector).

Monitor._description: Sextupole Excitation Current readback (Amperes). Proportional to sextupole field strength.

Setpoint._description: Sextupole Excitation Current setpoint (Amperes). Commanded focusing sextupole current for chromaticity correction.

SD._description: Defocusing Sextupoles: Sextupole magnets with negative polarity for chromatic correction. Work together with SF sextupoles to independently control horizontal and vertical chromaticity. 24 sextupoles total (2 per sector).

Monitor._description: Sextupole Excitation Current readback (Amperes). Proportional to sextupole field strength with negative polarity.

Setpoint._description: Sextupole Excitation Current setpoint (Amperes). Commanded defocusing sextupole current for chromaticity correction.

DCCT._description: DC Current Transformer: Measures total stored beam current with high precision using magnetic flux detection. Primary diagnostic for beam lifetime and top-off injection monitoring.

Monitor._description: Beam current in milliamperes. Total charge circulating in the storage ring.

FastMonitor._description: Fast beam current readback for monitoring transients and injection. 10 kHz sampling rate.

Lifetime._description: Calculated beam lifetime in hours based on current decay rate.

BEND._description: Bending Dipole Magnets: Main dipole magnets that bend the beam around the ring. 36 bending magnets total (3 per sector). Operate in series on a single power supply but have individual shunt controls.

Monitor._description: Dipole current readback in Amperes. Defines beam energy (1.9 GeV nominal).

Setpoint._description: Dipole current setpoint. Typically constant during operations.

Ready._description: Main dipole power supply ready status.

Thermocouple._description: Temperature Monitoring: Thermocouples mounted on vacuum chamber and insertion device beamlines. Critical for detecting excessive heat deposition from synchrotron radiation or beam losses. 10 sensors per instrumented sector.

Temperature._description: Temperature readback in Celsius. Monitors absorber and chamber temperatures.

Limit._description: Temperature limit setpoint. Triggers interlock if exceeded to protect equipment.

OverTemp._description: Over-temperature flag. Boolean indicating if temperature exceeds safe limit.

RF._description: Radio Frequency System: Provides energy to the beam through oscillating electromagnetic fields in RF cavities. Compensates for synchrotron radiation losses. Operating at 499.654 MHz (328th harmonic).

FrequencyMonitor._description: RF cavity frequency readback in MHz. Must match harmonic of beam revolution frequency.

FrequencySetpoint._description: RF cavity frequency setpoint in MHz. Commanded RF frequency.

VoltageMonitor._description: Cavity Gap Voltage readback in kilovolts. Peak RF voltage across accelerating gap. Determines energy gain per turn.

VoltageSetpoint._description: Cavity Gap Voltage setpoint in kilovolts. Commanded cavity gap voltage.

Forward._description: RF Forward Power in kilowatts. Power traveling from klystron toward cavity. Indicates RF drive strength.

Reflected._description: RF Reflected Power in kilowatts. Power bouncing back from cavity. Should be <5% of forward when tuned properly.

PhaseMonitor._description: RF Phase readback in degrees. Phase relationship between cavity and beam.

PhaseSetpoint._description: RF Phase setpoint in degrees. Controls synchronous phase.

CavityTemperature._description: RF cavity body temperature in Celsius. Water-cooled to maintain resonance frequency.

ID._description: Insertion Devices: Undulators and wigglers that produce intense, tunable X-ray beams for experiments. Located in straight sections. Gap controls photon energy spectrum.

GapMonitor._description: Insertion device gap readback in millimeters. Smaller gaps produce higher energy photons.

GapSetpoint._description: Insertion device gap setpoint in millimeters. User-requested gap for desired photon energy.

PermissionGranted._description: Beamline permission to move ID. Prevents unauthorized gap changes during user experiments.

Tune._description: Betatron Tune Measurement: Measures the number of transverse oscillations per revolution. Critical parameter for beam stability. Tunes must avoid resonances.

HorizontalMonitor._description: Horizontal tune readback. Fractional part of betatron oscillations per turn.

VerticalMonitor._description: Vertical tune readback. Fractional part of betatron oscillations per turn.

HorizontalSetpoint._description: Target horizontal tune. Adjusted via quadrupole currents.

VerticalSetpoint._description: Target vertical tune. Adjusted via quadrupole currents.

VAC._description: Storage Ring Vacuum System: Maintains ultra-high vacuum (UHV) to minimize beam-gas scattering and maximize beam lifetime. Typical operating pressure: 10^-9 to 10^-10 Torr. Distributed system with 72 ion pumps and 24 gauges across all 12 sectors.

IonPump._description: Ion Pumps: Sputter-ion pumps providing UHV pumping. Use high voltage to ionize and trap gas molecules. 6 pumps per sector for comprehensive coverage.

Pressure._description: Vacuum Pressure readback (Torr). Local chamber pressure calculated from pump current. Target: <1×10^-9 Torr for good beam lifetime.

Voltage._description: High Voltage Supply readback (Volts). Operating voltage for ion pump (typically 3-7 kV).

Current._description: Ion Pump Current readback (microAmperes). Current proportional to gas pumping rate. Low current (<1 μA) indicates good vacuum.

Gauge._description: Vacuum Pressure Gauges: Monitor vacuum pressure at critical locations. Independent measurement from ion pumps. Cold cathode or hot cathode ionization gauges. 2 gauges per sector for redundancy.

Pressure._description: Measured Pressure readback (Torr). Direct pressure reading from ionization gauge. True measurement (not calculated like ion pump pressure).

Scraper._description: Storage Ring Beam Scrapers: Movable collimators that define beam aperture and protect vacuum chamber. Used for beam size measurements and controlled beam loss. 4 scrapers at strategic locations around the ring.

TopPosition._description: Top scraper position readback in millimeters. Distance from beam center.

BottomPosition._description: Bottom scraper position readback in millimeters. Distance from beam center.

TopSetpoint._description: Top scraper position setpoint in millimeters.

BottomSetpoint._description: Bottom scraper position setpoint in millimeters.

BR._description: Booster Ring: Accelerates electron beam from 150 MeV (linac) to 1.9 GeV before injection into storage ring. Operates at 1-10 Hz repetition rate. Compact ring with 4-fold symmetry.

BPM._description: Beam Position Monitors in Booster Ring. Measure beam position during acceleration cycle. 8 BPMs for orbit measurement.

SumSignal._description: BPM sum signal proportional to beam intensity.

DCCT._description: Beam current monitor in Booster Ring. Tracks current during acceleration cycle.

Monitor._description: Beam current readback in milliamperes during booster cycle.

Dipole._description: Booster Ring Dipole Bending Magnets. Main bending magnets for booster orbit. Ramped during acceleration.

Monitor._description: Dipole excitation current readback (Amperes). Ramped to increase beam energy.

Setpoint._description: Dipole excitation current setpoint (Amperes). Programmed ramp for acceleration.

Quadrupole._description: Booster Ring Quadrupoles. 8 quadrupoles for focusing during acceleration.

Monitor._description: Quadrupole current readback during ramping cycle.

Setpoint._description: Quadrupole current setpoint. Programmed waveform for acceleration.

BTS._description: Booster-to-Storage transfer line: Beam transport line that guides accelerated beam from booster ring to storage ring. Includes steering magnets and diagnostics. ~35m beamline with 6 BPMs and 18 steering magnets.

BPM._description: Transfer line Beam Position Monitors. Monitor beam trajectory during injection. 6 BPMs along transport line.

SumSignal._description: BPM sum signal for beam intensity monitoring during transfer.

HCM._description: Horizontal steering magnets in transfer line. 9 correctors for trajectory control.

Monitor._description: Horizontal corrector current readback in Amperes.

Setpoint._description: Horizontal corrector current setpoint in Amperes.

Ready._description: Power supply ready status for horizontal correctors.

VCM._description: Vertical steering magnets in transfer line. 9 correctors for trajectory control.

Monitor._description: Vertical corrector current readback in Amperes.

Setpoint._description: Vertical corrector current setpoint in Amperes.

Ready._description: Power supply ready status for vertical correctors.

Quadrupole._description: Transfer line quadrupoles for beam matching. 11 quadrupoles shape beam for optimal injection.

Kicker._description: Injection kicker magnet: Fast pulsed magnet that deflects incoming beam from transfer line onto the storage ring orbit. Pulse width ~1 microsecond.

Monitor._description: Kicker voltage readback (kilovolts). Actual pulse voltage during injection.

Setpoint._description: Kicker voltage setpoint (kilovolts). Commanded pulse voltage for optimal injection.

Timing._description: Kicker pulse timing delay in microseconds. Synchronized with booster extraction.

Septum._description: Injection septum magnet: Thin current sheet that separates injected beam from circulating beam. Creates strong local field for beam deflection without disturbing stored beam. Two septa for clean separation.

Monitor._description: Septum current readback (Amperes). Measured current through septum conductor.

Setpoint._description: Septum current setpoint (Amperes). Commanded deflection current for injection trajectory.

TransferEfficiency._description: Injection efficiency monitoring. Ratio of injected charge to extracted charge from booster.

Monitor._description: Transfer efficiency as percentage. Target >95% for good injection.
